result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Plea/sentencing hearing on January 10, 2023 at 08:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Roy Daris T. Strait
Current: PO Box 3310, c/o Oshkosh Correctional Institution, Oshkosh, WI 54903 United States  (Effective: 08-26-2022)
Prior: 2833 Riverside Dr #A, Green Bay, WI 54301
No contact with T.E. and T.F.

Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY plea(s) entered.

State has complied with Victim Notification Statutes.
Victim is not present.

Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant regarding waiver of preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant's attorney.
Court finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the preliminary hearing. 
BY THE COURT: On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial.

1:58 PM Defendant Roydaris Travis Strait appeared by video, in custody at Oshkosh facility.  Attorney Maxwell Bergner in court for Roydaris Travis Strait.  Prosecuting attorney Andrew August Mutchler in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney/Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of the charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of the complaint.
Attorney waives time limits and waive the preliminary hearing.
Court questions the defendant if he is willing to have this hearing today even though the Judge knows the victims.
Defendant is willing to proceed today and understands.

State recommends a bond with conditions as stated.
BY THE COURT:  Bond is set
Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 24, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on October 24, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection. Filed by Atty Bergner.
